cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles (145 km) southeast of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the northwest Caribbean, forecast to enter the southern Gulf on Tuesday, then accelerate north-northeast toward the northern Gulf Coast – targeting southeast Louisiana and the Mississippi coast Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast, near or just west of the Mississippi River Delta (Plaquemines Parish–Buras area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Morgan City, LA to the Mississippi/Alabama border (including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, metropolitan New Orleans, and Plaquemines Parish); Storm Surge Watch Intracoastal City, LA to Navarre, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for northern Gulf at this time (warnings confined to Yucatán)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Likely (2–4 inches common, isolated 6 inches possible)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes (forecast 4–6 ft for Plaquemines–Port Fourchon stretch)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) likely with a chance of sustained hurricane-force gusts during Wednesday afternoon/evening
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation 4–6 ft above ground in portions of Plaquemines Parish, especially east of the Mississippi River and in bays
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated 6 inches; risk of flash and urban flooding at the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes and dangerous seas/waves in approaches to the Mississippi River; possible channel shoaling and debris transport
